instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
Hi there, new to the whole board repair stuff, so please bear with me

Got a 3115 with a huge hole by the LCD conn. pins 21 and 22
caps <CAPACITOR>C9796</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR> were blown off.

with <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> removed (looked messed up) and both aforementioned caps removed, I have full continuity to ground from pin 5 of <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
also full continuity to ground from the pads under pin 1 of both the <CAPACITOR>C9796</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR>.

any pointers of where to start?
again, sorry if I am clueless..

EDIT: History is liquid damage around the LCD and <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> area. not previously worked on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
Looks like you have a short in the board from <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> to GND. Sometimes you can dig it out at the LCD connector but many times you will have to lift every component on that line and run a wire to make your own rail. 
Don't dig too much around the LCD connector or risk messing up other traces. Do you at least have an image without backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
Thanks duke. Yeah i do get image, just no backlight.

Shit, this is going to be a pain in the bumhole..
I did indeed do some digging at the <CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C9796</CAPACITOR> area, but I can't seem to remove the short; it's only becoming more gross-looking. (L9080 is standing on the edge of a giant crater the size of fucking grandcanyon)

So i would have to run wires from and to every component on the <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> line, without them touching any parts of that original trace, right? Doesn't that mean i have to start at pin 5 from <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>? I can't use the probe point there, so i was thinking to attach a wire to the IC itself and have that run to the caps at the LCD Connector (which, in turn need to be off the board) ?
I guess i could mount the caps standing up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: Yup everything needs disconnected. You can forget about the small caps like <CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR>. I don't know how much time you have to waste, but I don't think I would bother with something like this.
